client_certificate_password.description: The password associated with the Client Certificate. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate

client_certificate_path.description: The path to the Client Certificate associated with the Service Principal for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Certificate.

client_id.description: The Client ID which should be used.

client_secret.description: The Client Secret which should be used. For use When authenticating as a Service Principal using a Client Secret.

disable_correlation_request_id.description: This will disable the x-ms-correlation-request-id header.

disable_terraform_partner_id.description: This will disable the Terraform Partner ID which is used if a custom `partner_id` isn't specified.

environment.description: The Cloud Environment which should be used. Possible values are public, usgovernment, and china. Defaults to public.

metadata_host.description: The Hostname which should be used for the Azure Metadata Service.

msi_endpoint.description: The path to a custom endpoint for Managed Service Identity - in most circumstances this should be detected automatically.

oidc_request_token.description: The bearer token for the request to the OIDC provider. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_request_url.description: The URL for the OIDC provider from which to request an ID token. For use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_token.description: The OIDC ID token for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

oidc_token_file_path.description: The path to a file containing an OIDC ID token for use when authenticating as a Service Principal using OpenID Connect.

partner_id.description: A GUID/UUID that is registered with Microsoft to facilitate partner resource usage attribution.

skip_provider_registration.description: Should the AzureRM Provider skip registering all of the Resource Providers that it supports, if they're not already registered?

storage_use_azuread.description: Should the AzureRM Provider use AzureAD to access the Storage Data Plane API's?

subscription_id.description: The Subscription ID which should be used.

tenant_id.description: The Tenant ID which should be used.

use_msi.description: Allowed Managed Service Identity be used for Authentication.

use_oidc.description: Allow OpenID Connect to be used for authentication

purge_soft_delete_on_destroy.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault` resources will be permanently deleted (e.g purged), when destroyed

purge_soft_deleted_certificates_on_destr.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault_certificate` resources will be permanently deleted (e.g purged), when destroyed

purge_soft_deleted_keys_on_destroy.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault_key` resources will be permanently deleted (e.g purged), when destroyed

purge_soft_deleted_secrets_on_destroy.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault_secret` resources will be permanently deleted (e.g purged), when destroyed

recover_soft_deleted_certificates.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault_certificate` resources will be restored, instead of creating new ones

recover_soft_deleted_key_vaults.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault` resources will be restored, instead of creating new ones

recover_soft_deleted_keys.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault_key` resources will be restored, instead of creating new ones

recover_soft_deleted_secrets.description: When enabled soft-deleted `azurerm_key_vault_secret` resources will be restored, instead of creating new ones

billing_type.description: The type of billing for the B2C tenant. Possible values include: `MAU` or `Auths`.

display_name.description: The initial display name of the B2C tenant.

domain_name.description: Domain name of the B2C tenant, including onmicrosoft.com suffix.

sku_name.description: Billing SKU for the B2C tenant. See https://aka.ms/b2cBilling for more information.

tenant_id.description: The Tenant ID for the B2C tenant.

app_id.description: The ID of the Windows or Linux Web App.

branch.description: The branch name to use for deployments.

rollback_enabled.description: Should the Deployment Rollback be enabled? Defaults to `false`.

scm_type.description: The SCM Type in use. This value is decoded by the service from the repository information supplied.

use_local_git.description: Should the App use local Git configuration.

use_manual_integration.description: Should code be deployed manually. Set to `false` to enable continuous integration, such as webhooks into online repos such as GitHub. Defaults to `false`.

use_mercurial.description: The repository specified is Mercurial. Defaults to `false`.

uses_github_action.description: Indicates if the Slot uses a GitHub action for deployment. This value is decoded by the service from the repository information supplied.

generate_workflow_file.description: Should the service generate the GitHub Action Workflow file. Defaults to `true`

linux_action.description: Denotes this action uses a Linux base image.

runtime_stack.description: The value to use for the Runtime Stack in the workflow file content for code base apps.

runtime_version.description: The value to use for the Runtime Version in the workflow file content for code base apps.

registry_password.description: The password used to upload the image to the container registry.

repo_url.description: The branch name to use for deployments.

use_mercurial.description: The repository specified is Mercurial. Defaults to `false`.

runtime_version.description: The value to use for the Runtime Version in the workflow file content for code base apps.

registry_password.description: The password used to upload the image to the container registry.

registry_username.description: The username used to upload the image to the container registry.

user_assigned_identity_id.description: The User Assigned Identity to use for Container Registry access.

container_app_environment_id.description: The ID of the Container App Environment to host this Container App.

custom_domain_verification_id.description: The ID of the Custom Domain Verification for this Container App.

latest_revision_fqdn.description: The FQDN of the Latest Revision of the Container App.

latest_revision_name.description: The name of the latest Container Revision.

name.description: The name for this Container App.

app_port.description: The port which the application is listening on. This is the same as the `ingress` port.

app_protocol.description: The protocol for the app. Possible values include `http` and `grpc`. Defaults to `http`.

allow_insecure_connections.description: Should this ingress allow insecure connections?

target_port.description: The target port on the container for the Ingress traffic.

transport.description: The transport method for the Ingress. Possible values include `auto`, `http`, and `http2`. Defaults to `auto`

certificate_binding_type.description: The Binding type. Possible values include `Disabled` and `SniEnabled`. Defaults to `Disabled`

name.description: The hostname of the Certificate. Must be the CN or a named SAN in the certificate.

label.description: The label to apply to the revision as a name prefix for routing traffic.

latest_revision.description: This traffic Weight relates to the latest stable Container Revision.

percentage.description: The percentage of traffic to send to this revision.

revision_suffix.description: The suffix string to append to the revision. This must be unique for the Container App's lifetime. A default hash created by the service will be used if this value is omitted.

password_secret_name.description: The name of the Secret Reference containing the password value for this user on the Container Registry.

server.description: The hostname for the Container Registry.

username.description: The username to use for this Container Registry.

name.description: The Secret name.

max_replicas.description: The maximum number of replicas for this container.

min_replicas.description: The minimum number of replicas for this container.

revision_suffix.description: The suffix for the revision. This value must be unique for the lifetime of the Resource. If omitted the service will use a hash function to create one.

args.description: A list of args to pass to the container.

command.description: A command to pass to the container to override the default. This is provided as a list of command line elements without spaces.

cpu.description: The amount of vCPU to allocate to the container. Possible values include `0.25`, `0.5`, `0.75`, `1.0`, `1.25`, `1.5`, `1.75`, and `2.0`. **NOTE:** `cpu` and `memory` must be specified in `0.25'/'0.5Gi` combination increments. e.g. `1.0` / `2.0` or `0.5` / `1.0`

ephemeral_storage.description: The amount of ephemeral storage available to the Container App.

image.description: The image to use to create the container.

memory.description: The amount of memory to allocate to the container. Possible values include `0.5Gi`, `1.0Gi`, `1.5Gi`, `2.0Gi`, `2.5Gi`, `3.0Gi`, `3.5Gi`, and `4.0Gi`. **NOTE:** `cpu` and `memory` must be specified in `0.25'/'0.5Gi` combination increments. e.g. `1.25` / `2.5Gi` or `0.75` / `1.5Gi`

name.description: The name of the container.
The name of the environment variable for the container.

failure_count_threshold.description: The number of consecutive failures required to consider this probe as failed. Possible values are between `1` and `10`. Defaults to `3`.

host.description: The probe hostname. Defaults to the pod IP address. Setting a value for `Host` in `headers` can be used to override this for `http` and `https` type probes.

initial_delay.description: The time in seconds to wait after the container has started before the probe is started.

interval_seconds.description: How often, in seconds, the probe should run. Possible values are between `1` and `240`. Defaults to `10`

path.description: The URI to use with the `host` for http type probes. Not valid for `TCP` type probes. Defaults to `/`.

port.description: The port number on which to connect. Possible values are between `1` and `65535`.

termination_grace_period_seconds.description: The time in seconds after the container is sent the termination signal before the process if forcibly killed.

timeout.description: Time in seconds after which the probe times out. Possible values are between `1` an `240`. Defaults to `1`.

transport.description: Type of probe. Possible values are `TCP`, `HTTP`, and `HTTPS`.

allowed_audiences.description: Specifies a list of Allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by Azure Active Directory.

enabled.description: Should this backup job be enabled?

name.description: The name which should be used for this Backup.

storage_account_url.description: The SAS URL to the container.

frequency_interval.description: How often the backup should be executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to `7` and `frequency_unit` should be set to `Day`).

frequency_unit.description: The unit of time for how often the backup should take place. Possible values include: `Day` and `Hour`.

keep_at_least_one_backup.description: Should the service keep at least one backup, regardless of age of backup. Defaults to `false`.

last_execution_time.description: The time the backup was last attempted.

retention_period_days.description: After how many days backups should be deleted.

start_time.description: When the schedule should start working in RFC-3339 format.

name.description: The name which should be used for this Connection.

type.description: Type of database. Possible values include: `MySQL`, `SQLServer`, `SQLAzure`, `Custom`, `NotificationHub`, `ServiceBus`, `EventHub`, `APIHub`, `DocDb`, `RedisCache`, and `PostgreSQL`.

always_on.description: If this Linux Web App is Always On enabled. Defaults to `false`.

api_definition_url.description: The URL of the API definition that describes this Linux Function App.

api_management_api_id.description: The ID of the API Management API for this Linux Function App.

app_command_line.description: The program and any arguments used to launch this app via the command line. (Example `node myapp.js`).

app_scale_limit.description: The number of workers this function app can scale out to. Only applicable to apps on the Consumption and Premium plan.

application_insights_connection_string.description: The Connection String for linking the Linux Function App to Application Insights.

application_insights_key.description: The Instrumentation Key for connecting the Linux Function App to Application Insights.

container_registry_managed_identity_clie.description: The Client ID of the Managed Service Identity to use for connections to the Azure Container Registry.

container_registry_use_managed_identity.description: Should connections for Azure Container Registry use Managed Identity.

default_documents.description: Specifies a list of Default Documents for the Linux Web App.

elastic_instance_minimum.description: The number of minimum instances for this Linux Function App. Only affects apps on Elastic Premium plans.

ftps_state.description: State of FTP / FTPS service for this function app. Possible values include: `AllAllowed`, `FtpsOnly` and `Disabled`. Defaults to `Disabled`.

health_check_eviction_time_in_min.description: The amount of time in minutes that a node is unhealthy before being removed from the load balancer. Possible values are between `2` and `10`. Defaults to `10`. Only valid in conjunction with `health_check_path`

health_check_path.description: The path to be checked for this function app health.

http2_enabled.description: Specifies if the http2 protocol should be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

managed_pipeline_mode.description: The Managed Pipeline mode. Possible values include: `Integrated`, `Classic`. Defaults to `Integrated`.

minimum_tls_version.description: The configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests. Possible values include: `1.0`, `1.1`, and  `1.2`. Defaults to `1.2`.

pre_warmed_instance_count.description: The number of pre-warmed instances for this function app. Only affects apps on an Elastic Premium plan.

remote_debugging_enabled.description: Should Remote Debugging be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

remote_debugging_version.description: The Remote Debugging Version. Possible values include `VS2017`, `VS2019`, and `VS2022``

runtime_scale_monitoring_enabled.description: Should Functions Runtime Scale Monitoring be enabled.

scm_minimum_tls_version.description: Configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests to the SCM site Possible values include: `1.0`, `1.1`, and  `1.2`. Defaults to `1.2`.

scm_type.description: The SCM Type in use by the Linux Function App.

scm_use_main_ip_restriction.description: Should the Linux Function App `ip_restriction` configuration be used for the SCM also.

use_32_bit_worker.description: Should the Linux Web App use a 32-bit worker.

vnet_route_all_enabled.description: Should all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied? Defaults to `false`.

websockets_enabled.description: Should Web Sockets be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

worker_count.description: The number of Workers for this Linux Function App.

disk_quota_mb.description: The amount of disk space to use for logs. Valid values are between `25` and `100`.

retention_period_days.description: The retention period for logs in days. Valid values are between `0` and `99999`. Defaults to `0` (never delete).

dotnet_version.description: The version of .Net. Possible values are `3.1`, `6.0` and `7.0`

java_version.description: The version of Java to use. Possible values are `8`, `11`, and `17`

node_version.description: The version of Node to use. Possible values include `12`, and `14`

powershell_core_version.description: The version of PowerShell Core to use. Possibles values are `7`, and `7.2`

python_version.description: The version of Python to use. Possible values include `3.9`, `3.8`, and `3.7`.

use_dotnet_isolated_runtime.description: Should the DotNet process use an isolated runtime. Defaults to `false`.

image_name.description: The name of the Docker image to use.

image_tag.description: The image tag of the image to use.

registry_password.description: The password for the account to use to connect to the registry.

registry_url.description: The URL of the docker registry.

registry_username.description: The username to use for connections to the registry.

allowed_origins.description: Specifies a list of origins that should be allowed to make cross-origin calls.

support_credentials.description: Are credentials allowed in CORS requests? Defaults to `false`.

app_settings.description: A map of key-value pairs for [App Settings](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-app-settings) and custom values.

builtin_logging_enabled.description: Should built in logging be enabled. Configures `AzureWebJobsDashboard` app setting based on the configured storage setting.

client_certificate_enabled.description: Should the Function App Slot use Client Certificates.

client_certificate_exclusion_paths.description: Paths to exclude when using client certificates, separated by ;

client_certificate_mode.description: The mode of the Function App Slot's client certificates requirement for incoming requests. Possible values are `Required`, `Optional`, and `OptionalInteractiveUser`.

content_share_force_disabled.description: Force disable the content share settings.

daily_memory_time_quota.description: The amount of memory in gigabyte-seconds that your application is allowed to consume per day. Setting this value only affects function apps in Consumption Plans.

enabled.description: Is the Linux Function App Slot enabled.

function_app_id.description: The ID of the Linux Function App this Slot is a member of.

functions_extension_version.description: The runtime version associated with the Function App Slot.

https_only.description: Can the Function App Slot only be accessed via HTTPS?

key_vault_reference_identity_id.description: The User Assigned Identity to use for Key Vault access.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Function App Slot.

storage_account_access_key.description: The access key which will be used to access the storage account for the Function App Slot.

storage_account_name.description: The backend storage account name which will be used by this Function App Slot.

storage_key_vault_secret_id.description: The Key Vault Secret ID, including version, that contains the Connection String to connect to the storage account for this Function App.

storage_uses_managed_identity.description: Should the Function App Slot use its Managed Identity to access storage?

additional_login_parameters.description: Specifies a map of Login Parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when a user logs in.

allowed_external_redirect_urls.description: Specifies a list of External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the Windows Web App.

default_provider.description: The default authentication provider to use when multiple providers are configured. Possible values include: `AzureActiveDirectory`, `Facebook`, `Google`, `MicrosoftAccount`, `Twitter`, `Github`.

enabled.description: Should the Authentication / Authorization feature be enabled?

issuer.description: The OpenID Connect Issuer URI that represents the entity which issues access tokens.

runtime_version.description: The RuntimeVersion of the Authentication / Authorization feature in use.

token_refresh_extension_hours.description: The number of hours after session token expiration that a session token can be used to call the token refresh API. Defaults to `72` hours.

token_store_enabled.description: Should the Windows Web App durably store platform-specific security tokens that are obtained during login flows? Defaults to `false`.

unauthenticated_client_action.description: The action to take when an unauthenticated client attempts to access the app. Possible values include: `RedirectToLoginPage`, `AllowAnonymous`.

allowed_audiences.description: Specifies a list of Allowed audience values to consider when validating JWTs issued by Azure Active Directory.

client_id.description: The ID of the Client to use to authenticate with Azure Active Directory.

client_secret.description: The Client Secret for the Client ID. Cannot be used with `client_secret_setting_name`.

client_secret_setting_name.description: The App Setting name that contains the client secret of the Client. Cannot be used with `client_secret`.

app_id.description: The App ID of the Facebook app used for login.

app_secret.description: The App Secret of the Facebook app used for Facebook Login. Cannot be specified with `app_secret_setting_name`.

app_secret_setting_name.description: The app setting name that contains the `app_secret` value used for Facebook Login. Cannot be specified with `app_secret`.

oauth_scopes.description: Specifies a list of OAuth 2.0 scopes to be requested as part of Facebook Login authentication.

client_id.description: The ID of the GitHub app used for login.

client_secret.description: The Client Secret of the GitHub app used for GitHub Login. Cannot be specified with `client_secret_setting_name`.

client_secret_setting_name.description: The app setting name that contains the `client_secret` value used for GitHub Login. Cannot be specified with `client_secret`.

oauth_scopes.description: Specifies a list of OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of GitHub Login authentication.

client_id.description: The OpenID Connect Client ID for the Google web application.

client_secret.description: The client secret associated with the Google web application.  Cannot be specified with `client_secret_setting_name`.

client_secret_setting_name.description: The app setting name that contains the `client_secret` value used for Google Login. Cannot be specified with `client_secret`.

oauth_scopes.description: Specifies a list of OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Google Sign-In authentication. If not specified, "openid", "profile", and "email" are used as default scopes.

client_id.description: The OAuth 2.0 client ID that was created for the app used for authentication.

client_secret.description: The OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for authentication. Cannot be specified with `client_secret_setting_name`.

client_secret_setting_name.description: The app setting name containing the OAuth 2.0 client secret that was created for the app used for authentication. Cannot be specified with `client_secret`.

oauth_scopes.description: The list of OAuth 2.0 scopes that will be requested as part of Microsoft Account authentication. If not specified, `wl.basic` is used as the default scope.

consumer_key.description: The OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in.

consumer_secret.description: The OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in. Cannot be specified with `consumer_secret_setting_name`.

consumer_secret_setting_name.description: The app setting name that contains the OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in. Cannot be specified with `consumer_secret`.

enabled.description: Should this backup job be enabled?

name.description: The name which should be used for this Backup.

storage_account_url.description: The SAS URL to the container.

frequency_interval.description: How often the backup should be executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to `7` and `frequency_unit` should be set to `Day`).

frequency_unit.description: The unit of time for how often the backup should take place. Possible values include: `Day` and `Hour`.

keep_at_least_one_backup.description: Should the service keep at least one backup, regardless of age of backup. Defaults to `false`.

last_execution_time.description: The time the backup was last attempted.

retention_period_days.description: After how many days backups should be deleted.

start_time.description: When the schedule should start working in RFC-3339 format.

name.description: The name which should be used for this Connection.

type.description: Type of database. Possible values include: `MySQL`, `SQLServer`, `SQLAzure`, `Custom`, `NotificationHub`, `ServiceBus`, `EventHub`, `APIHub`, `DocDb`, `RedisCache`, and `PostgreSQL`.

always_on.description: If this Linux Web App is Always On enabled. Defaults to `false`.

api_definition_url.description: The URL of the API definition that describes this Linux Function App.

api_management_api_id.description: The ID of the API Management API for this Linux Function App.

app_command_line.description: The program and any arguments used to launch this app via the command line. (Example `node myapp.js`).

app_scale_limit.description: The number of workers this function app can scale out to. Only applicable to apps on the Consumption and Premium plan.

application_insights_connection_string.description: The Connection String for linking the Linux Function App to Application Insights.

application_insights_key.description: The Instrumentation Key for connecting the Linux Function App to Application Insights.

container_registry_managed_identity_clie.description: The Client ID of the Managed Service Identity to use for connections to the Azure Container Registry.

container_registry_use_managed_identity.description: Should connections for Azure Container Registry use Managed Identity.

default_documents.description: Specifies a list of Default Documents for the Linux Web App.

elastic_instance_minimum.description: The number of minimum instances for this Linux Function App. Only affects apps on Elastic Premium plans.

ftps_state.description: State of FTP / FTPS service for this function app. Possible values include: `AllAllowed`, `FtpsOnly` and `Disabled`. Defaults to `Disabled`.

health_check_eviction_time_in_min.description: The amount of time in minutes that a node is unhealthy before being removed from the load balancer. Possible values are between `2` and `10`. Defaults to `10`. Only valid in conjunction with `health_check_path`

health_check_path.description: The path to be checked for this function app health.

http2_enabled.description: Specifies if the http2 protocol should be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

load_balancing_mode.description: The Site load balancing mode. Possible values include: `WeightedRoundRobin`, `LeastRequests`, `LeastResponseTime`, `WeightedTotalTraffic`, `RequestHash`, `PerSiteRoundRobin`. Defaults to `LeastRequests` if omitted.

managed_pipeline_mode.description: The Managed Pipeline mode. Possible values include: `Integrated`, `Classic`. Defaults to `Integrated`.

minimum_tls_version.description: The configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests. Possible values include: `1.0`, `1.1`, and  `1.2`. Defaults to `1.2`.

pre_warmed_instance_count.description: The number of pre-warmed instances for this function app. Only affects apps on an Elastic Premium plan.

remote_debugging_enabled.description: Should Remote Debugging be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

remote_debugging_version.description: The Remote Debugging Version. Possible values include `VS2017`, `VS2019`, and `VS2022`

runtime_scale_monitoring_enabled.description: Should Functions Runtime Scale Monitoring be enabled.

scm_minimum_tls_version.description: Configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests to the SCM site Possible values include: `1.0`, `1.1`, and  `1.2`. Defaults to `1.2`.

scm_type.description: The SCM Type in use by the Linux Function App.

scm_use_main_ip_restriction.description: Should the Linux Function App `ip_restriction` configuration be used for the SCM also.

use_32_bit_worker.description: Should the Linux Web App use a 32-bit worker.

vnet_route_all_enabled.description: Should all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied? Defaults to `false`.

websockets_enabled.description: Should Web Sockets be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

worker_count.description: The number of Workers for this Linux Function App.

disk_quota_mb.description: The amount of disk space to use for logs. Valid values are between `25` and `100`.

enabled.description: Should this backup job be enabled?

name.description: The name which should be used for this Backup.

storage_account_url.description: The SAS URL to the container.

frequency_interval.description: How often the backup should be executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to `7` and `frequency_unit` should be set to `Day`).

frequency_unit.description: The unit of time for how often the backup should take place. Possible values include: `Day` and `Hour`.

keep_at_least_one_backup.description: Should the service keep at least one backup, regardless of age of backup. Defaults to `false`.

last_execution_time.description: The time the backup was last attempted.

retention_period_days.description: After how many days backups should be deleted.

start_time.description: When the schedule should start working in RFC-3339 format.

name.description: The name which should be used for this Connection.

type.description: Type of database. Possible values include: `MySQL`, `SQLServer`, `SQLAzure`, `Custom`, `NotificationHub`, `ServiceBus`, `EventHub`, `APIHub`, `DocDb`, `RedisCache`, and `PostgreSQL`.

always_on.description: If this Windows Web App is Always On enabled. Defaults to `false`.

api_definition_url.description: The URL of the API definition that describes this Windows Function App.

api_management_api_id.description: The ID of the API Management API for this Windows Function App.

app_command_line.description: The program and any arguments used to launch this app via the command line. (Example `node myapp.js`).

app_scale_limit.description: The number of workers this function app can scale out to. Only applicable to apps on the Consumption and Premium plan.

application_insights_connection_string.description: The Connection String for linking the Windows Function App to Application Insights.

application_insights_key.description: The Instrumentation Key for connecting the Windows Function App to Application Insights.

default_documents.description: Specifies a list of Default Documents for the Windows Web App.

elastic_instance_minimum.description: The number of minimum instances for this Windows Function App. Only affects apps on Elastic Premium plans.

ftps_state.description: State of FTP / FTPS service for this function app. Possible values include: `AllAllowed`, `FtpsOnly` and `Disabled`. Defaults to `Disabled`.

health_check_eviction_time_in_min.description: The amount of time in minutes that a node is unhealthy before being removed from the load balancer. Possible values are between `2` and `10`. Defaults to `10`. Only valid in conjunction with `health_check_path`

health_check_path.description: The path to be checked for this function app health.

http2_enabled.description: Specifies if the http2 protocol should be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

load_balancing_mode.description: The Site load balancing mode. Possible values include: `WeightedRoundRobin`, `LeastRequests`, `LeastResponseTime`, `WeightedTotalTraffic`, `RequestHash`, `PerSiteRoundRobin`. Defaults to `LeastRequests` if omitted.

managed_pipeline_mode.description: The Managed Pipeline mode. Possible values include: `Integrated`, `Classic`. Defaults to `Integrated`.

minimum_tls_version.description: The configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests. Possible values include: `1.0`, `1.1`, and  `1.2`. Defaults to `1.2`.

pre_warmed_instance_count.description: The number of pre-warmed instances for this function app. Only affects apps on an Elastic Premium plan.

remote_debugging_enabled.description: Should Remote Debugging be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

remote_debugging_version.description: The Remote Debugging Version. Possible values include `VS2017`, `VS2019`, and `VS2022`

runtime_scale_monitoring_enabled.description: Should Functions Runtime Scale Monitoring be enabled.

scm_minimum_tls_version.description: Configures the minimum version of TLS required for SSL requests to the SCM site Possible values include: `1.0`, `1.1`, and  `1.2`. Defaults to `1.2`.

scm_type.description: The SCM Type in use by the Windows Function App.

scm_use_main_ip_restriction.description: Should the Windows Function App `ip_restriction` configuration be used for the SCM also.

use_32_bit_worker.description: Should the Windows Web App use a 32-bit worker.

vnet_route_all_enabled.description: Should all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied? Defaults to `false`.

websockets_enabled.description: Should Web Sockets be enabled. Defaults to `false`.

worker_count.description: The number of Workers for this Windows Function App.

disk_quota_mb.description: The amount of disk space to use for logs. Valid values are between `25` and `100`.

retention_period_days.description: The retention period for logs in days. Valid values are between `0` and `99999`. Defaults to `0` (never delete).

dotnet_version.description: The version of .Net. Possible values are `v3.0`, `v4.0`, `v6.0` and `v7.0`

java_version.description: The version of Java to use. Possible values are `1.8`, `11` and `17`

node_version.description: The version of Node to use. Possible values include `12`, and `14`

powershell_core_version.description: The PowerShell Core version to use. Possible values are `7`, and `7.2`

use_custom_runtime.description: Does the Function App use a custom Application Stack?

use_dotnet_isolated_runtime.description: Should the DotNet process use an isolated runtime. Defaults to `false`.

allowed_origins.description: Specifies a list of origins that should be allowed to make cross-origin calls.

support_credentials.description: Are credentials allowed in CORS requests? Defaults to `false`.

app_settings.description: A map of key-value pairs for [App Settings](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-app-settings) and custom values.

builtin_logging_enabled.description: Should built in logging be enabled. Configures `AzureWebJobsDashboard` app setting based on the configured storage setting.

client_certificate_enabled.description: Should the Function App Slot use Client Certificates.

client_certificate_exclusion_paths.description: Paths to exclude when using client certificates, separated by ;

client_certificate_mode.description: The mode of the Function App Slot's client certificates requirement for incoming requests. Possible values are `Required`, `Optional`, and `OptionalInteractiveUser`.

content_share_force_disabled.description: Force disable the content share settings.

custom_domain_verification_id.description: The identifier used by App Service to perform domain ownership verification via DNS TXT record.

daily_memory_time_quota.description: The amount of memory in gigabyte-seconds that your application is allowed to consume per day. Setting this value only affects function apps in Consumption Plans.

default_hostname.description: The default hostname of the Windows Function App Slot.

enabled.description: Is the Windows Function App Slot enabled.

function_app_id.description: The ID of the Windows Function App this Slot is a member of.

functions_extension_version.description: The runtime version associated with the Function App Slot.

https_only.description: Can the Function App Slot only be accessed via HTTPS?

key_vault_reference_identity_id.description: The User Assigned Identity to use for Key Vault access.

kind.description: The Kind value for this Windows Function App Slot.

name.description: Specifies the name of the Windows Function App Slot.

outbound_ip_address_list.description: A list of outbound IP addresses. For example `["52.23.25.3", "52.143.43.12"]`.

outbound_ip_addresses.description: A comma separated list of outbound IP addresses as a string. For example `52.23.25.3,52.143.43.12`.

possible_outbound_ip_address_list.description: A list of possible outbound IP addresses, not all of which are necessarily in use. This is a superset of `outbound_ip_address_list`. For example `["52.23.25.3", "52.143.43.12"]`.

possible_outbound_ip_addresses.description: A comma separated list of possible outbound IP addresses as a string. For example `52.23.25.3,52.143.43.12,52.143.43.17`. This is a superset of `outbound_ip_addresses`. For example `["52.23.25.3", "52.143.43.12","52.143.43.17"]`.

storage_account_access_key.description: The access key which will be used to access the storage account for the Function App Slot.

storage_account_name.description: The backend storage account name which will be used by this Function App Slot.

storage_key_vault_secret_id.description: The Key Vault Secret ID, including version, that contains the Connection String to connect to the storage account for this Function App.

storage_uses_managed_identity.description: Should the Function App Slot use its Managed Identity to access storage?

additional_login_parameters.description: Specifies a map of Login Parameters to send to the OpenID Connect authorization endpoint when a user logs in.

allowed_external_redirect_urls.description: Specifies a list of External URLs that can be redirected to as part of logging in or logging out of the Windows Web App.

consumer_key.description: The OAuth 1.0a consumer key of the Twitter application used for sign-in.

consumer_secret.description: The OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in. Cannot be specified with `consumer_secret_setting_name`.

consumer_secret_setting_name.description: The app setting name that contains the OAuth 1.0a consumer secret of the Twitter application used for sign-in. Cannot be specified with `consumer_secret`.

enabled.description: Should this backup job be enabled?

name.description: The name which should be used for this Backup.

storage_account_url.description: The SAS URL to the container.

frequency_interval.description: How often the backup should be executed (e.g. for weekly backup, this should be set to `7` and `frequency_unit` should be set to `Day`).

frequency_unit.description: The unit of time for how often the backup should take place. Possible values include: `Day` and `Hour`.

keep_at_least_one_backup.description: Should the service keep at least one backup, regardless of age of backup. Defaults to `false`.

last_execution_time.description: The time the backup was last attempted.

retention_period_days.description: After how many days backups should be deleted.

start_time.description: When the schedule should start working in RFC-3339 format.

name.description: The name which should be used for this Connection.

type.description: Type of database. Possible values include: `MySQL`, `SQLServer`, `SQLAzure`, `Custom`, `NotificationHub`, `ServiceBus`, `EventHub`, `APIHub`, `DocDb`, `RedisCache`, and `PostgreSQL`.

health_check_eviction_time_in_min.description: The amount of time in minutes that a node is unhealthy before being removed from the load balancer. Possible values are between `2` and `10`. Defaults to `10`. Only valid in conjunction with `health_check_path`

vnet_route_all_enabled.description: Should all outbound traffic to have Virtual Network Security Groups and User Defined Routes applied? Defaults to `false`.

dotnet_core_version.description: The version of DotNetCore to use.

java_embedded_server_enabled.description: Should the application use the embedded web server for the version of Java in use.

allowed_origins.description: Specifies a list of origins that should be allowed to make cross-origin calls.

support_credentials.description: Are credentials allowed in CORS requests? Defaults to `false`.

billing_type.description: The type of billing for the B2C tenant. Possible values include: `MAU` or `Auths`.

data_residency_location.description: Location in which the B2C tenant is hosted and data resides.

domain_name.description: Domain name of the B2C tenant, including onmicrosoft.com suffix.

effective_start_date.description: The date from which the billing type took effect. May not be populated until after the first billing cycle.

sku_name.description: Billing SKU for the B2C tenant.

tenant_id.description: The Tenant ID for the B2C tenant.

default_domain.description: The default publicly resolvable name of this Container App Environment

docker_bridge_cidr.description: The network addressing in which the Container Apps in this Container App Environment will reside in CIDR notation.

infrastructure_subnet_id.description: The existing Subnet in use by the Container Apps Control Plane.

internal_load_balancer_enabled.description: Does the Container Environment operate in Internal Load Balancing Mode?

log_analytics_workspace_name.description: The name of the Log Analytics Workspace this Container Apps Managed Environment is linked to.

name.description: The name of the Container Apps Managed Environment.

platform_reserved_cidr.description: The IP range, in CIDR notation, that is reserved for environment infrastructure IP addresses.

platform_reserved_dns_ip_address.description: The IP address from the IP range defined by `platform_reserved_cidr` that is reserved for the internal DNS server.

static_ip_address.description: The Static IP Address of the Environment.

container_app_environment_id.description: The Container App Managed Environment ID to configure this Certificate on.

expiration_date.description: The expiration date for the Certificate.

issue_date.description: The date of issue for the Certificate.

name.description: The name of the Container Apps Certificate.

subject_name.description: The Subject Name for the Certificate.

client_certificate_exclusion_paths.description: Paths to exclude when using client certificates, separated by ;

storage_key_vault_secret_id.description: The Key Vault Secret ID, including version, that contains the Connection String used to connect to the storage account for this Function App.
